    • Uses of Play.Character in dsl

      Subclasses of Play.Character in dsl 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  Play.StatelessCharacter
      A character that uses Actor directly, i.e., has no internal state.
      Methods in dsl with parameters of type Play.Character 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <B extends Actor<P>>
      void      		 Play.Character.query(Play.Character<B> receiver, UnaryWithActor<P,B> process, java.lang.String queryName)
      Makes the character query another character.
      void Play.Character.send(Play.Character<?> receiver, java.lang.String name)
      Makes the character send a message to another character.
      void Play.Character.send(Play.Character<?> receiver, java.lang.String name, int timeout)
      Same as #send(Character, String), but allows specifying a timeout, after which the message will no longer be received (a SendException might be raised if the character is unable to proceed without this message).
      void Play.Character.send(Play.Character<?> receiver, SupplierWithActor<P,A> onSend, java.lang.String name)
      Makes the character send a message to another character.
      void Play.Character.send(Play.Character<?> receiver, SupplierWithActor<P,A> onSend, java.lang.String name, int timeout)
      Same as #send(Character, SupplierWithActor, String), but allows specifying a timeout, after which the message will no longer be received (a SendException might be raised if the character is unable to proceed without this message).
      <B extends Actor<P>>
      void      		 Play.Character.send(Play.Character<B> receiver, ConsumerWithActor<P,B> onReceive, java.lang.String name)
      Makes the character send a message to another character.
      <B extends Actor<P>>
      void      		 Play.Character.send(Play.Character<B> receiver, ConsumerWithActor<P,B> onReceive, java.lang.String name, int timeout)
      Same as #send(Character, ConsumerWithActor, String), timeout, after which the message will no longer be received (a SendException might be raised if the character is unable to proceed without this message).
      <B extends Actor<P>>
      void      		 Play.Character.send(Play.Character<B> receiver, SupplierWithActor<P,A> onSend, ConsumerWithActor<P,B> onReceive, java.lang.String name)
      Makes the character send a message to another character.
      <B extends Actor<P>>
      void      		 Play.Character.send(Play.Character<B> receiver, SupplierWithActor<P,A> onSend, ConsumerWithActor<P,B> onReceive, java.lang.String name, int timeout)
      Same as #send(Character, SupplierWithActor, ConsumerWithActor, String, int) , timeout, after which the message will no longer be received (a SendException might be raised if the character is unable to proceed without this message).
